reviewText: Unfortunately, this short feature, apparently produced around 1950 for Japanese TV, has titles, hosting, and narration in Japanese. The elderly Steichen is shown examining and praising (in English) several Japanese photos (which we never get to examine) that may have been submitted for the Family of Man exhibit. I can see very little instructional value in this film, except as an example of the post-WWII American effort to establish cultural dialog with former enemies.Steichen
